instruction: In a large bowl, mix yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, biryani masala, salt, and a pinch of sugar until well combined.
title: Prepare the marinade

transcript_segments.text: Today we are going to make a tasty, rich, and very popular Kolkata-style biryani. In this video, we have made this biryani in a very simple way. So let’s begin making it. For this, we need 1.25 kg of chicken.

Add two teaspoons of red chili powder and salt to taste. I’m adding two teaspoons here. Then we’ll add two tablespoons of biryani masala. The link to this biryani masala recipe is given here; you can check out the recipe.
Mix the chicken well with the spices and leave it to marinate in the fridge for two hours. Now in a pot, take one cup of oil. Add 2–3 bay leaves, 2–3-inch pieces of cinnamon, 6–7 green cardamoms.

instruction: Add the mutton to the marinade and coat evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight.
title: Marinate the mutton

title: Prep the potatoes

instruction: Heat mustard oil in a pan and shallow fry the potatoes until golden on all sides. Set aside.
title: Fry the potatoes

transcript_segments.text: First, fry these whole spices in the oil for 2–3 minutes. Take two medium-sized onions, sliced, and add them in. Fry the onions until they turn a nice golden color.

instruction: Thinly slice the onions for frying.
title: Slice the onions

transcript_segments.text: First, fry these whole spices in the oil for 2–3 minutes. Take two medium-sized onions, sliced, and add them in. Fry the onions until they turn a nice golden color.

instruction: Deep fry the sliced onions in hot oil until golden brown and crisp. Drain on paper towels and set aside.
title: Fry the onions (beresta)

transcript_segments.text: First, fry these whole spices in the oil for 2–3 minutes. Take two medium-sized onions, sliced, and add them in. Fry the onions until they turn a nice golden color.

instruction: In a large heavy-bottom pot, heat mustard oil and add bay leaves, cloves, cardamoms, cinnamon, mace, and nutmeg.
title: Heat whole spices

transcript_segments.text: First, fry these whole spices in the oil for 2–3 minutes. Take two medium-sized onions, sliced, and add them in. Fry the onions until they turn a nice golden color.

instruction: Add the marinated mutton to the pot. Cook on medium-high heat until the meat starts to brown and the oil begins to separate.
title: Cook the mutton

transcript_segments.text: First, fry these whole spices in the oil for 2–3 minutes. Take two medium-sized onions, sliced, and add them in. Fry the onions until they turn a nice golden color.

instruction: Once the mutton is nearly tender, add the fried potatoes and cook together for a few minutes to absorb flavor.
title: Add fried potatoes to mutton

transcript_segments.text: Add ginger-garlic paste and fry it well with the onions. Then add the chicken and mix everything together. Let the chicken cook. Meanwhile, let’s get the potatoes ready.

Here I’ve taken peeled potatoes, about 750 grams. If you have large potatoes, you can cut them into two pieces. Using a knife, make holes in the potatoes like this so they cook thoroughly and absorb the spices inside.

Add half a teaspoon of turmeric. If you prefer, you can use yellow food color instead of turmeric. Also add one teaspoon of Kashmiri red chili powder. Now we need to cook the potatoes with the chicken—not too much, just enough. Add them to the chicken.

Now cook the chicken and potatoes together on medium to low flame for 20–25 minutes. While the chicken is cooking, we will prepare the rice. To prepare the rice, take 3–4 times more water than the quantity of rice.

instruction: In a small bowl, soak saffron strands in warm milk for 10 minutes.
title: Soak saffron

transcript_segments.text: As soon as the water boils, add the rice. This is one kilogram of basmati rice, which has been soaked for half an hour and rinsed thoroughly. Add it in. Add two teaspoons of salt and two teaspoons of lemon juice.

instruction: Mix rose water and kewra water into the saffron milk. Set aside.
title: Add aromatic waters

transcript_segments.text: As soon as the water boils, add the rice. This is one kilogram of basmati rice, which has been soaked for half an hour and rinsed thoroughly. Add it in. Add two teaspoons of salt and two teaspoons of lemon juice.

instruction: Boil a large pot of water with salt and whole garam masalas. Add rinsed basmati rice and cook until 70% done. Drain immediately.
title: Parboil the rice

transcript_segments.text: As soon as the water boils, add the rice. This is one kilogram of basmati rice, which has been soaked for half an hour and rinsed thoroughly. Add it in. Add two teaspoons of salt and two teaspoons of lemon juice.

instruction: Lightly grease the base of a heavy-bottomed pot with ghee.
title: Grease the biryani pot

transcript_segments.text: As soon as the water boils, add the rice. This is one kilogram of basmati rice, which has been soaked for half an hour and rinsed thoroughly. Add it in. Add two teaspoons of salt and two teaspoons of lemon juice.

instruction: Spread a layer of cooked mutton and potatoes at the bottom of the pot.
title: First layer - mutton and potatoes

transcript_segments.text: The potatoes have become nice and soft. Now sprinkle one teaspoon of biryani masala over them. Cook the rice till it’s 80% done, then drain it and spread it over the chicken.

instruction: Add a layer of the parboiled rice over the mutton.
title: Second layer - rice

transcript_segments.text: The potatoes have become nice and soft. Now sprinkle one teaspoon of biryani masala over them. Cook the rice till it’s 80% done, then drain it and spread it over the chicken.

instruction: Sprinkle fried onions, garam masala powder, a few drops of ghee, and a portion of the saffron milk mixture over the rice.
title: Add toppings to layer

transcript_segments.text: Now take one cup of milk. I’m adding half a teaspoon of saffron to it and two drops of kewra water. Mix it well. I’m adding yellow food coloring powder; you can use liquid if preferred. Add two teaspoons of rose water.

Add 4–5 tablespoons of desi ghee. Now pour the milk mixture we just prepared all over the rice. This mixture gives a beautiful color and amazing aroma to the biryani. Now we will put the biryani on dum (slow steam cooking).

instruction: Repeat the layering with the remaining mutton, rice, and toppings, finishing with rice on top.
title: Repeat layers

transcript_segments.text: Add 4–5 tablespoons of desi ghee. Now pour the milk mixture we just prepared all over the rice. This mixture gives a beautiful color and amazing aroma to the biryani. Now we will put the biryani on dum (slow steam cooking).

instruction: Cover the pot with a tight lid or seal it with dough to trap the steam.
title: Seal the pot

transcript_segments.text: If you want, you can seal the lid using dough. Now place the lid. Let the biryani cook on low flame for 15–20 minutes. After 15–20 minutes, remove the lid and the aluminum foil from the top.

instruction: Place the sealed pot over a low flame or a griddle and cook for 30–40 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
title: Dum cook the biryani

transcript_segments.text: If you want, you can seal the lid using dough. Now place the lid. Let the biryani cook on low flame for 15–20 minutes. After 15–20 minutes, remove the lid and the aluminum foil from the top.

instruction: Turn off the heat and let the biryani rest, covered, for 10 minutes before opening.
